thread.title: How to watch Bills-Jaguars: Game streamed for free, won't be on TV
thread.title_full: How to watch Bills-Jaguars: Game streamed for free, won't be on TV | syracuse.com

author: Matthew Fairburn | mfairburn@syracuse.com
title: How to watch Bills-Jaguars: Game streamed for free, won't be on TV
text:
London â€” When the Buffalo Bills take on the Jacksonville Jaguars at 9:30 a.m in London. Sunday morning, most fans won't be able to watch by simply flipping on the TV.
The game will be televised on CBS in only the Buffalo and Jacksonville areas (and not in Syracuse or Rochester), and it won't be on DirecTV, either.
However, the game will be streamed for free by Yahoo. It is the first game in NFL history that will be streamed globally. Anyone with an internet connection will have access to the game.
Here's what you need to do to watch the game:
Connect your computer (or another device such as Apple TV, Roku or Xbox) to the Internet. Visit Yahoo.com or install the Yahoo app on your phone or tablet Click the link on Sunday at 9:30 a.m.
